intro: Centrolepis mutica, commonly known as the woolly centrolepis, is a unique plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and compact growth habit. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in spikelets. Centrolepis mutica is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is well adapted to arid environments.
